reviews.review: If you can deal with the bugs and stiff movement controlls (especially on horseback) then the game is pretty damn fun, and the lore is necessary if you want to know your way around the sequel.\

I have purchased this game no less than 6 times.

It's terrible.

10/10, will probably buy again

Great game ! Right up there with elder scrolls. I like Two Worlds  better than oblivion and equal with morrowind. The graphics are a bit dated but not that bad - like xbox 360 era graphics. Its a little slow getting started but you level fast so the talent tree will have you growing more powerful in no time. im level 29 at the moment and there are still areas in the game i will not survive. I think the main story is good and i enjoy the side quests/stories as well. lots of reviews are complaining about the voice acting....its not that bad at all. ive definitely heard worse !   I highly recommend this game i got in in a package deal " Two Worlds collection" im glad i played this first before jumping right into the more modern Two Worlds 2. its really a great adventure worth playing. if you like elder scrolls type games you wont want to miss this.

 The only thing that had me frustrated at first is the registration.  If you have a PC that has onboard graphics and hgh powered video card it will probably auto run the game to the onboard if its decent ( i have HD 4600 which is impressive for onboard ) anyway when i tried to force my high powered video card to run the game, the game thought i was trying to register the same game code on a different computer and wouldnt allow me to log in. so make sure you force the correct video card to run the game before you register,

Это одна из моих любимых игр. Я прошёл её полностью, то есть выполнил основной, сюжетный квест так же выполнил все остальные разумеется за исключением тех которые пересекаются, [это значит что в этих квестах вам нужно выбирать чьё именно задание выполнять: например вам предложат убить капитана из деревни(если я не ошибаюсь) а он предложит вам убить заказчика]. Но прошол я её на пиратке(кстати сохранения с пиратке работают и здесь). Насколько я понял здесь есть сетевая игра я заходил на сервера, но особо долго там не играл, да и признаться людей там не так много как хотелось бы. 
Единственная пожалyй проблема с которой я столкнyлся(как на пиратке так и здесь) это то что бывают проблемы с запуском но их не трудно устранить в интернете куча способов.Сама игра очень крутая, много различных существ, оружия, брони и магии, так же очень понравилась графика, конечно она несколько хуже чем во второй части, но мне она понравилась даже больше. Вообщем игра замечательная покупайте и наслаждайтесь игрой!

Have eased my way into this game coming from Elder Scrolls games, not that big into strict RPGs but I do enjoy Two Worlds, has many nice elements and an interesting story line. The only con to this game is the voice acting in it, its horrid, but if you can get past the monotone and uninteresting voices this is a great game!

This game is so objectively bad.  Why do I enjoy playing it so much?  This game is some kind of anomaly.

Like...this game is really bad but I can't stop playing it.

The voice overs are beyond awful.  The graphics are bad.  The animations suck.  Riding on a horse nearly gives you a seizure because it is so jerky.

And yet, there's just something in there that is just so fun to play.  I do love the loot, magic, and leveling systems.

Great game. Had it on windows XP and it works great. Got it on steam now for my new PC, but it refuses to work on windows 8.1 pro. Honestly, I'm having a hard time recommending this game on Steam, since the problem seems to be the Reality Pump DRM system, which locks up the game BEFORE i have a chance to enter the game's serial. If this single problem can be solved, either by Valve or by Reality Pump, so their DRM actually WORKS instead of locking up the game, then i'll be more than happy to revise this recommendation.

Please, do not be mistaken, the game is great, just this problem is stopping me from enjoying the game on my new PC.
I got a quest from a guy named hoe. 10/10 would buy again.
I lIke this game, however the combat system detracts from the gameplay very dramatically. This game makes me wonder "what if?".

This game starts out mediocre like just your normal free roam rpg, but for some reason these 6 year old graphics and voice acting, this game is super addicting, I have no clue why but this is the only game i've ever beater and then became sad that it didnt last longer. If you can catch it on sale I'd buy it in a heartbeat, then buy the sequel to make it last even longer. This game competes with oblivion and is just as addicting. 10/10 would buy again times 10

Underneath this somewhat unpolished game, marred by huge expectations (pre-release hype expected this game to be the next Oblvion open-world game), and a horrible buggy release, lies an enjoyable, often unique open-world RPG game, a game that I can recommend to open-minded gamers.

It's amazing I can say that because on release, when I first got the Xbox 360 version, it looked like I had made a mistake. Tons of framerate issues, game-breaking bugs, and moreover a very unimpressive intro and beginner newbie area. The game eventually got patched, and I enjoyed it enough to later buy the PC version, and for my friends and I, Two Worlds 1 has become a guilty pleasure. I actually bought this twice on the PC, directly from publisher and later via Steam, so my hours don't reflect all of my accumulated playing time.

I have to stress, though, that you have to weather the horrible beginning of the game. The game cinematic intro is uninspiring, then it drops you into a forest area, eventually giving you a barebones tutorial that doesn't show you the cool features of the game. On top of that, you have to make your way to your first town which sports some of the worst voice acting I've heard heard in a game. Fortunately, the voice acting improves a bit as you get further into the game, however the dialogue is still pretty bad, but you get used to it.

On your way to the town, you may get mauled by wolves, which travel in packs, which until you learn the agro system of the game, you may die repeatedly.  So often, gamers will just quit at this point, several hours into the game, which is a shame, and I believe why most people didn't give this game a fair shake.  Lots to learn -- how to use the magic system, how to collect ingredients, how to handle night time creatures in the game (you won't be able to kill them initially so run away from them), etc.

I really liked the weapon-combining system which I wish more games would implement.  You can combine similar weapons to upgrade your main weapon, so alleviates inventory issues, just keep combing that generic sword over and over. It also solves the moan-and-groan of finding junk loot, because in this game, you can make an uber weapon out of crappy weapons. Of course, eventually you'll want to combine higher-level weapons, but it's a great way to lessen inventory issues.

I also loved the co-op feature, able to the play the entire game again with a friend. Not sure if you can still do this, though, because I don't remember if it needed access to original Two Worlds servers.

Character models may look a bit dated, but the world still looks pretty good, and it has a lot of variety. Lots of side-quest and secrets to explore and enough variety to replay the game with different classes, which is also a strength, Classes aren't set in stone, but you can develop your character however way you want. Some people have issues with the mounting system, getting aggravated with the horse mount, but I found the PC version is far improved over the 360 version.

Two Worlds 2, the sequel,  is by far, a more polished game, but TW1 sports a larger world, and doesn't have the weapon combining feature. If you can do some reading of the game mechanics, and not give up right away, you may find yourself enjoying this game.
Очень неплохая игра есть как плюсы так и минусы. Один из минусов это непонятная регистрация после активации кода. Еще бы неплохо было б хотя бы перевести интерфейс на русский, а так я дам 6/10

Don't compare this game to Oblivion. Try Gothic 1, then compare games again... or try Arx Fatalis and come back.

Two Worlds is a grand effort from a small team to try to make a game they'd want to play. A labor of love, so to speak. It's for that reason why I love the Gothic series (especially the third one).

In Two Worlds, you don't get the feel and controls of a triple A game franchise. You get handcrafted, homecooked, delicious, awkward experimentation from gamers who love games.

Remember Peter Jackson's first few movies? Would it surprise you to know that the guy who gave us all the Lord of the Rings movies started out just making random, insane films, like "Dead Alive" and "Meet the Feebles"? Innovation requires risk.

Two Worlds does things a bit differently and that's what's worth taking notice of. Sure, horse controls are awkward, and your main character says "Mayhap" and "Perchance" enough times in the first hour to make you want to invent time travel and murder ancient languages... but keep playing.

Keep playing and discover an absolutely massive world with very, very little loading time, and a Morrowind-esque combat system. I dislike the Oblivion comparison because that game was truly real-time and Two Worlds is more die-rolls and random chance based on skill percentages like Morrowind, Dungeons and Dragons, Shadowrun, and... well... 80% of CRPG's that have come out in the last 35 years.

In summation:
Voice acting: Bad to the point of comedic.
Combat: Die rolls... not Oblivion.
World: HOLY COW this thing is huge.
Gameplay: Enough variation to keep me coming back.
Horses: Not as good as Mount & Blade, but better than Ride to Hell Retribution.
Replayability: Mayhap I should complete it once before I judge this.

Two World's Epic Edition is of such quality that I can only compare it to Seth Rogen's "The Interview": A lot of people said a lot of things about it, but when I finally saw it for myself, I realized that people don't really know anything and I should just judge things for myself. It's not perfect, but I like it anyway.
if you like horrible rpgs ones that give you diaheria while playing this is your game

I've only really started playing this game today, and I have to say, for it being quite an old game it is still fun to play, and worth a try if you are looking for a rpg to play. I really like the alchemy system, you have 4 slots I believe if i can remember, and you get ingredients from plants or wildlife that give you buffs. The skill system makes sense and I honestly have no problem with it, it has a sense of progression. For instance you have to be a certain level before you can put more points into a skill. This way you don't find yourself leveling one skill the entire time. I also like the fact that there is reputation with the factions in the game. It runs on a scale of 1-10, 1 being not important and 10 being very important. The more quests you do for a faction the more rep you gain. The questing is fun and the voice acting isn't really all that bad, It's better than reading quests (Morrowind). At the beginning it is sort of rough, but once you can get some gear from crushing some Grom skulls you'll be fine :)

The framerate was horrendous but it's actually a lot of fun, I can't really explain it. The combat is a lot of fun, plus the armor and swords all look really cool.

I would try it for a new experience, but don't expect it to be an Elder Scrolls level quality.

The voice acting is possibly the worst I have ever heard in a game. After a few hours of play it just became a part of the game that was more comical  than annoying. 

The rest of the game feels a lot like a lower budget Oblivion or Skyrim. Its fun to play with a decent, but not great, story line. 

I would probably give this 3.5 out of 5 stars. Worth a play if your into the open world, light action, RPGs, but I would definately not get it if it isnt on sale.

The game starts out as a fun hack and slash game, but soon the limited story, near no choice, repetative encounters(oh look, yet more wolves waiting to get oneshot), and POOR COMBAT MECHANICS become obvious.

Lots of item variety and looks, at the cost of any substance or depth to them, just numbers.  Magic being limited to 3 spells set up at a time makes it near unusable, trainers being often hidden(archery comes to mind), to the point where initially only melee is viable at the start.  30 levels in(and 10 hours) swapped to magic with gear to match.  total headache, much weaker then melee.

But then, even melee, apart from the passive skills, you are often swarmed with enemies, and often end up knocked down, or going 2hander for the aoe. 

Alchemy hands down sucks in this game, with so much wasted potential.

Was fun for 5 hours, then it slowly went downhill.

Would not recommend.  Go play gothic or, (more similair) risen or something.

Tworlds: Epic Edition is actually a fun game. I came into the game knowing that it was not the best game, not what it was hyped up to be, and I enjoyed it. It is much better on pc than it was on console. There is no combat lag that I could tell, and the combat reminded me of dark souls which I had a ton of fun playing.

The game is only $3 on the Black Friday sale and is a great buy for anyone who is into RPGs and is looking for another one to add to their collection. The game has its bugs and glitches, but if you can look past them I know everyone will enjoy the game. The best part about knowing that it is a bad game is that you can laugh at stuff that happens like the dialogue and some of the combat mechanics and noises.
Actually not a bad game at all!

I know this got bad reviews and a lot of people hate it. It is a glorified hack and slash in an open world. I have always had a lot of fun with it though. I like the alchemy that uses rare ingredients to add permanently to your characters stats. I like picking an armor and a weapon and finding as many copies as possible to boost them. The voice acting and copywriting is pretty bad, but the premise is ok. The graphics are not the greatest but are not as bad as some people say. To me they don't have to be picture realiztic for a game to be immersive...but then I did play Zork at maximum verbosity back in the day so maybe I'm used to using my imagination.

Bottom line. I have fun with this. I have replayed it several times over the years. And I paid 99 cents for it on Steam. There's no down side there.

One of the few games I have ever played that manage to make mage characters both vulnerable and also crazy powerful.  (Basically only games based on older D&D rules (such as Baldurs gate) have done similar, at least in my experience.)

Also your character is goddamn fantastic at times and is voiced by the most fitting voice imaginable.

Don't play this game.It is impossible to play online!!!

...no doubt worthy of being called "a modern-retro classic," if such a term may be applied to something other than 2D pixels...

Regarding multiplayer: 
Only one server based in Europe is active. 
Textures are prone to spazzing, 
Creatures will float if near an edge (i.e. cave walls/stairs up a tower), 
The horrible connection (am using Hamachi, have done all I know to do) reduces melee combat to "I can't even 'Jump Back' (dodge) since it never registers proper (get hit before or right after having done so - as in, enemies warp to you because of the lag, so it's futile to try), just rush, respawn, keep rushing." 
TO BE SURE, it seems the longer you stay in-game, the stronger the connection becomes. Not sure of how much sense that makes but both my friend and I have noticed it; patience is necessary.

Despite all that, I feel this game does not deserve the terrible reviews it has garnered; perhaps I'm a dope for being satisfied with it, perhaps others expected too much of it. 

This game is reminiscent of the Souls games + Oblivion; the gear and progression is apparently like in the Souls games (so says my buddy, I've not played them much) - the environments are straight out of Tamriel. 

There is a bare minimum of hand-holding; every time I play the game, I learn something new. If the combat/connection was tweaked a little tighter, I would no doubt be playing the game constant. There is a sequel though, and it is seriously mind-blowing how much better it is (though some of the tweaks are for the worse).

You can combine gear of the same type to strengthen it; you can learn any skill you want to - can respec your character - though it might just be better to pay the 500 gold (not so steep after a few levels) to make a new one. ALSO, BE SURE, after your first character, TO GO BUY EVERY SKILL YOU WANT WHEN YOUR NEW CHARACTER IS LEVEL 0 - each skill costs 100 gold from the beginning, but after a few levels, it goes from 1,000 to 10,000... so yeah.

For what it is, and the discounted price of $1 - if you have great patience and the ability to find fun in a game's faults (none quite so game-breaking, have crashed only once, because of Steam, not the game), Two Worlds is worth consideration.

Should you get it, addressing your choice of Class:
Recall what I said about melee, if you want to be a Knight/Barbarian - be patient and bear in mind it is an old game (if nothing else, go to single player, I had zero issues in the short time I tried it); 
You must spend ALL your points in Archery should you wish to be a Thief/Archer  (otherwise you will literally connect one out of a hundred arrows, if that many) - Dexterity is required to use some of the better shields; 
Wizards are, as always, badass - I don't think you need a robe or a staff to cast, so up your magic appropriately then get strength so you can use armor.
Really, unless you are going as a wizard, Strength and Dexterity (of course Vitality every couple levels or so) deserve the most attention; though the Wizards are overpowered, it seems much of the gear is inclined to melee, or at least STRONG, characters.

had problems getting to work at first but then i just looked around and found this on this on the steam fourms
Official Nvidia fix for the startup crash
On the Nvidia site there is the "Nvidia PhysX Legacy Software" which fixes all problems related to older games requiring older versions of PhysX drivers.
It will not affect your newer version of PhysX drivers.
The link is here http://www.nvidia.com/object/physx-9.12.1031-legacy-driver.html

I think that if you buy this game thinking it's going to be a perfect experience, you have been living under a rock. Do you not know how to Google a game that is old as hell? However, I love this game. It's a terrible game with some good mechanics (combining armor/weapons to make better armor weapons) and some funish spells.

I can safely say the best part is the ridiculous voice acting and dialog. "LOOKS LIKE MY MOTHER IN LAW!"

O grafico do jogo é muito bom, pensava que era mais fraco. A jogabilidade é um pouco diferente do que estou habituado, em relação aos controles e ao combate, mas logo você se habitua. No começo do jogo é para sair do templo e não tentar abrir aquela segunda grade; perdi um tempo considerável para perceber isso. 

Mundo livre e um bom game de RPG, recomendo.

One of my all time favorite games. I first played this on the 360 and beat it over and over to get all of the alternate endings. I decided to pick up the pc version and renew my love for this game.
Офигенная игра, не смотря на возраст! У кого не работает помотрите решение на форуме!

Ok, I just bought the game on steam for $1 as the epic edition (on sake at 80%) apparently after having been patched to hell and back and...you know what? It's not horrible. I get that that it's long past the redemption area now but it's actually quite playable and compared to the 360 version, there is no frame-rate issue...and I'm playing this on an Ideapad with integrated graphics. Yes combat is a bit loose and awkward but it is doable and the story and dialogue aren't that bad. Exploration is huge and vast. Respawning is a nice change of pace from some RPGs I've played. Is it Oblivion or better than? No. Is it now a competent RPG on its own? Yes, actually. I paid a buck and...I got a lot more than my money's worth.﻿

Same as how Crash Time II is a poor mans Burnout, Two Worlds is a poor mans Oblivion. That being said it's not a bad game. It's got some really cool enviroments and a really nice sound track. Just like how Bioshock was the spiritual successer to System Shock, Two Worlds is the spiritual successer to Quest 64. The game was way too over hyped and wanted to change the way RPGs work. But it fell short. Again it's not a bad experience and not a bad game, it was just trying to be something it could never become. I would still reccomend Oblivion over this but if you just want a fun and cheap RPG this is for you. Fun, good weapon ugrade system and awesome magic. 6/10

Pros:
      1. Great Open world to explore and discover stuff
      2. One of those games that the more you play, the better your guy gets, no cap
      3. Gameplay is fun
      4. Quests aren't repetitive
Cons:
      1. Acting is TERRIBLE
      2. Graphics are not the best, its a pretty old game after all
      3. Quests are annoying at times, like i said, acting is really bad
      4. Can get quite annoying

Reason for recommendation:
      While the acting is terrible and the quests can be annoying, I personally enjoyed it just cause you can go out and just level up endlessly and the gear has a fun upgrading system, you can get more of the same item and combine them to make it better, but it will still be the same item. So, say you take out a tower, and like every other guy had the same weapon. You can then take all the weapons and combine them together and get a weapon that may just be better than what you're using. Worst comes to worst you can always sell it and not worry about having to carry around 15+ weapons to get your gold. I have always enjoyed a game that has endless upgrading. This one is enjoyable too if you can get past the terrible acting and just do your own thing.
Отличная олдскульная РПГ, в ней есть все: множество квестов, предметов, огромная карта мира, интереснейшая система магии и даже мультиплеер.

Now that I've picked up this Steam Ed. the memories came back to me as to why I removed it from my game collection back when it was new and on CD.  Game play feels flat and forced. Bad voice acting and clumsy combat. Worst? Played out story line.  Damsel in distress… DRM useless, causes nothing but problems running the game.

Then the way you upgrade your items?  Never understood that, played deep into the game never knowing that was the case.  Just purchased more powerful items till I was forced to a standstill in the game.


Man I wished I’d remembered this game from back in the day, because bottom line it’s NOT an RPG unless you can select both genders as a player.  99 cent buy and the opening music is great, that's all I really liked about this game.

How can a game be terrible and awesome at the same time? I don't know, but that is the case here. Bugs, glitches, terrible voice acting and vanilla writing mask a large, enjoyable open world, a confusing but rewarding alchemy system, a ton of loot, and enjoyable exploration. I love this game, and when it's on sale it is an incredible value. If you like B movies and Oblivion, this is their bastard child.

"Мы хотели сделать Oblivion, не получилось", так можно охарактеризовать данную игру. Модели и текстуры невообразимо жуткие, система прокачки уныла до безобразия, желание играть в это, пропадает уже после первой кат сцены. 
P.S. у данной версии ужаснейшая система активации, которую то ли не удалили при добавлении в стим, то ли посчитали, что сбор данных о людях, купивших ЭТО - важное занятие.
